programme.desc: 8/8. A' spothadh each Przewalski's, lannsaireachd air retriever is beathaichean beag Bharraigh. A Przewalski's horse gets castrated, cats and dogs in Barra and surgery on a retriever.

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: 7/13. Drama Gàidhlig stèidhichte ann an Leòdhas. Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis.

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: 7/10. The town is deserted as everybody is at the town hall, where a visiting wrestling troupe has laid down the gauntlet to the locals.

programme.title: Alleluia!/Spiritual Music & Verse
programme.desc: 2/12. Iain MacFhionghain le laoidhean, sailm agus sgeulachdan pearsanta mu chreideamh. Iain Mackinnon with psalms, hymns and personal faith stories.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: Sealladh ùr bho Alba. A new view from Scotland.

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: 16/26. More and more objects are disappearing in town: Célestine's notebook, Boléro's hat, Mrs Tupile's binoculars, and even... the Green Mouse's cape! What's going on here?

programme.title: Meaban is Moo
programme.desc: 8/10. Tha Linda a' tadhal air Meaban is Moo gus dùbhlan a chur romhpa. An-diugh feumaidh iad rudan dearg a lorg. Linda visits Meaban and Moo who are challenged to find red items.

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 33/40. The Fuigheag cho measail air a bhith a' cluich le putain. Fuigheag loves to play with buttons!

programme.title: Boban is Fuigheag
programme.desc: 34/40. Feumar lorg fhaighinn air na buicein-teatha sa chidsin an-diugh. The teabags need to be located in the kitchen today.

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: 2/20. Tha rudeigin ann nach eil ceart oir tha fàile neònach air an tuathanas. Something is not right as there's an odd smell on the farm.

programme.title: Gasta a' Ghraineag/Happy the Hoglet
programme.desc: 9/26. Chan eil Gasta idir sona oir that eòin air na sùbhan-làir aige ithe. Gasta is not at all happy as birds have eaten his strawberries.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 3/9. Mischa Nic a' Phearsain a' leughadh Mòd Mheadhan-oidhche. Mischa Macpherson reads Mòd Mheadhan-oidhche.

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc: 1/7. Abdullah and his friends build a tower to lookout for his lost father. Tha Abdullah agus a charaidean a' togail tùr-fàire gus sùil a chumail a-mach airson athar.

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 6/13. Tha Flix ag ionnsachadh rud no dha bho mhàirneal an-diugh. Flix learns a few things from detention today.

programme.title: Bogaisean is...
programme.desc: ...Gumbalan/Bottersnikes and Gumbles. 20/52. Tha Dùd a' tàladh chnuimhean agus ri tarraing buaireadh cuideachd! Dùd is attracting cnuimhean but also causing conflict!

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 1/12. The CBBC ALBA presenters love a good challenge but who will emerge victorious as Mhairi joins them?

programme.title: A' Chùil
programme.desc: 14/14. Tha Choirstaidh a' lorg an reasabaidh as fheàrr airson "slime". Choirstaidh is looking for the best slime recipe.

programme.title: An Là
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, nàiseanta is eadar-nàiseanta gach là cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Mod 2025: Buinn Oir a' Chomuinn Ghaidhealaich
programme.desc: 3/7. Cathy NicDhòmhnaill le farpais Bhuinn Òir A' Chomuinn Ghàidhealaich. Cathy Macdonald presents live coverage of the An Comunn Gàidhealach Gold Medal final.

programme.title: Cuirm@Celtic Connections: Co-sheirm
programme.desc: 5/6. Cuirm-chiùil le Karen Nic Mhathain, Mischa Nic a' Phearsain agus Darren MacIlleathain. Concert with Karen Matheson, Mischa MacPherson and Darren MacLean.

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions: Dluth an Daimh
programme.desc: 3/6. With collaborative performances from Michael Doucet and Sharon Shannon, Darrell Scott and Karen Matheson as well as Iris DeMent and Emmylou Harris.

programme.title: Leonardo da Vinci - An...
programme.desc: ...Cruthadair - Pàirt a Dha/Painter-God - Part 2. 4/4. In France, Leonardo creates a portrait that would become the most famous painting ever.

programme.title: Skipinnish aig a' Chaisteal (Shorts)
programme.desc: 2/10. Skipinnish perform Coire Bhreacan in front of thousands of fans at a concert celebrating 25 years of the band, from Edinburgh Castle.

programme.title: Martin Luther King: Days of Hope - Reputations
programme.desc: A revealing portrait of the life, character and inner struggles of Martin Luther King Jr.

programme.title: Face to Face: Martin Luther King
programme.desc: First transmitted in 1961, Martin Luther King talks to John Freeman about the events that led to him becoming a civil rights leader.

programme.title: Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built
programme.desc: 1/5. The inside story of the design and construction of the Severn Bridge.

programme.title: Munro: Mountain Man
programme.desc: Nicholas Crane unravels the tale of Sir Hugh Munro, whose exploration of the wild Scottish peaks little more than a century ago began a modern mountaineering obsession.

programme.title: Strauss: The Waltz King
programme.desc: Lesley Garrett narrates a drama documentary that tells the compelling story of the waltz and the bitter father and son rivalry behind it.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: 5/10. Monty Don sees the world through 80 of its most inspiring gardens. He meets garden guerrillas in New York and visits a Virginian garden that reflects the birth of the nation.

programme.title: The Great Philosophers

programme.title: The Great Philosophers

programme.title: Top Gun: Maverick

programme.desc: (2021) Sci-fi action. Mark Wahlberg discovers that his hallucinations are memories from past lives. There are others like him, but they don't all have good intentions...

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: (1962) Historical drama with Ralph Richardson. A retelling of the stand made at Thermopylae in 480 BC by a small Greek force against invasion by an enormous Persian army.

programme.title: Henry VIII and His Six Wives
programme.desc: (1972) Historical drama with Keith Michell as Henry VIII, nobly supported by Donald Pleasance, Charlotte Rampling and Jane Asher. The dying monarch reviews his own life.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: (1959) Western. Randolph Scott plays a bounty hunter who has unfinished business with the brother of his latest target. But his quest for revenge looks like it could be undermined.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: (1949) This dark comedy from Ealing studios sees Alec Guinness take on the roles of eight characters, all the noble victims of a vengeance-seeking relative, played by Dennis Price.

programme.title: Land
programme.desc: (2021) Wilderness drama with Robyn Wright. After experiencing a personal tragedy, a woman moves to the Rockies in search of isolation. But can she survive there?

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: (2017) Fantasy adventure starring Matt Damon and Willem Dafoe. In 11th-century China, Europeans seeking the secret of gunpowder are caught up in a war against alien monsters.

programme.title: The Forever Purge
programme.desc: (2021) Dystopian crime thriller sequel. The NFFA are back. The Purge is back. Racists feel empowered. And when migrants start to go missing in Texas, it seems like the Purge will never end.

programme.title: Piggy
programme.desc: (2022) Suspenseful slasher horror starring Laura Galán as a bullied teenager whose tormentors get what's coming to 'em, but perhaps not in a way she'd fully support... In Spanish/subs.

programme.title: 13 Rue Madeleine
programme.desc: (1947) WWII drama. James Cagney stars as the tough US secret agent overseeing a special mission to discover the location of the factory where the Nazis are manufacturing their flying bombs.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: (1955) Cold War-influenced western starring Glenn Ford and Edward G Robinson. A smallholder stands alone against the expansionist plans and brutal tactics of a tyrannical rancher.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: (1954) Crime-comedy starring Alec Guinness. A priest is tasked with accompanying a priceless religious artifact from London to Rome. But the prolific thief Flambeau is hot on his trail...

programme.title: A Christmas Carol
programme.desc: (1984) George C Scott stars in Clive Donner's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic festive fantasy. The miserly curmudgeon Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by three ghosts of Christmas.

programme.title: Ad Astra
programme.desc: (2019) Visually stunning sci-fi starring Brad Pitt as a famously cool astronaut sent to the edges of the solar system to save Earth from deadly power surges. With Tommy Lee Jones.

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly-tinged but ultimately feel-good comedy starring Tom Hanks as a grumpy misanthrope who spends his time badgering people into following society's rules. But why is he like this?

programme.title: Nuns on the Run
programme.desc: (1990) Eric Idle and Robbie Coltrane star as small-time crooks who accidentally steal £1m and are forced to hide in a convent to escape both the police and the mob.

programme.title: The Eyes of Tammy Faye
programme.desc: (2021) Jessica Chastain puts in a barnstorming performance as the glitzy televangelist in the kind of real-life rise and fall that just seems made for the movies. With Andrew Garfield.

programme.title: Fire Down Below

programme.desc: Baddesley Clinton 2: The team value more rarities at Baddesley Clinton, near Solihull, including a rare silver box and a painting entitled The Nudist Colony's Annual Dinner Dance.

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: On the 100th anniversary of the Russian Revolution, Simon Reeve embarks on a journey from the snow-capped volcanoes of Kamchatka and Yakutia to the port of Vladivostok and on to Siberia.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Royal Highland Fusilier: The Royal Highland Fusilier, a 100-ton Deltic diesel engine, must be hauled from Leicestershire to Wirksworth in Cheshire.

programme.title: New: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: Rusty Rescue: A rusty 10-ton water tank gets cut off of a vintage engine in the Adelaide Hills, and Kuranda Scenic Railway carriages get spruced up by the Queensland Rail carpentry team.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Bedford Caravanette/MGC: An impressive collection of five iconic cars arrives at Thornton le Dale, including a 1967 Crayford Corsair and a 1966 Ford Zodiac which emerge from a garage in Selby.
